thread.title: Malaysia Airlines end of Summer Sale and Voucher Giveaway
thread.title_full: Malaysia Airlines end of Summer Sale and Voucher Giveaway

author: mich@girlracer.me.uk (Michelle Chenery)
title: Malaysia Airlines end of Summer Sale and Voucher Giveaway
text:
Malaysia Airlines end of Summer Sale and Voucher Giveaway Malaysia Airlines end of Summer Sale and Voucher Giveaway Details Category: Airport & Airline   15:45 Following the success of previous shopping voucher giveaways, Malaysia Airlines has re-launched the popular scheme for agents. For every first and business class ticketed sale made for travel completed on or before 31 May 2016, Malaysia Airlines are awarding a voucher* worth up to £50. For every return economy class ticketed sale, a voucher* will be awarded worth up to £10. The scheme will run up to 15 September 2015. 
As an End of Summer Bonus, double rewards are on offer for all bookings with an outbound travel period of 01 September – 30 November 2015, meaning the chance to earn up to £100 when booking a return business class ticket. To participate, agents should register at www.malaysiaairlinesgiveaway.co.uk, start booking Malaysia Airlines tickets and claim their rewards. In addition to submitting their ticketed sales, agents can also view their sales tally online. Malaysia Airlines has also launched its End of Summer Sale with great savings to destinations across Malaysia, South East Asia and Australasia, allowing for an extended summer in an exotic location. Book now until 15 September 2015 to take advantage of the End of Summer Sale, which is valid for economy class travel between 01 September – 09 December 2015 and 01 April – 31 May 2016. Business class passengers can travel between 01 September – 09 December 2015 and 18 January – 31 May 2016. Return economy flights from London Heathrow start at £499 to Kuala Lumpur; £509 to Ko Samui, Jakarta and Ho Chi Minh City; £519 to Phuket, Hanoi, Manila and Singapore; £529 to Bangkok and Denpasar, Bali; £539 to Phnom Penh and Siem Reap; £549 to Langkawi and Penang; £589 to Kota Kinabalu, Kuching and Yangon; £629 to Perth; £649 to Darwin; £699 to Adelaide and Melbourne; £719 to Sydney and £829 to Auckland. Return business class flights from London Heathrow start at £2709 to Kuala Lumpur; £2769 to Langkawi and Penang; £2779 to Kota Kinabalu and Kuching; £3199 to Australia including Darwin, Perth, Adelaide and Melbourne; £3209 to Sydney and £3389 to Auckland. Malaysia Airlines flies a twice-daily A380 service between London Heathrow and Kuala Lumpur International with connections across Malaysia, South East Asia and Australasia. Passengers from across the UK can connect via Malaysia Airlines oneworld partners. Economy class passengers can now enjoy two free checked baggage allowance of up to 30kg, with business class passengers receiving 40kg. Related articles
